newsitem.title: USA: Hicks Muse in $173 mln deal for 32 radio stations.
newsitem.headline: Hicks Muse in $173 mln deal for 32 radio stations.

text.p: Hicks, Muse, Tate & Furst Inc and Capstar Broadcasting Partners Tuesday said they definitively agreed to acquire 32 radio stations in mid-sized markets from Benchmark Communications in a cash deal valued at about $173 million.

Hicks Muse of Dallas is a private investment firm and Capstar Broadcasting of Austin is a radio investment group formed earlier this year by Hicks Muse and R. Steven Hicks, Capstar's chairman and chief executive. Benchmark Communications of Baltimore owns radio stations throughout the Southeast and Middle Atlantic.

The deal is expected to close by June 30, 1997, and brings to the total number of middle-market radio station acquisitions announced by Hicks Muse and Capstar since Capstar's formation in May 1996 to 103, and the capital value of the transactions to a total of more than $550 million.
